answers.text:
Hi Scott, 
To help your local government get started with social media I have listed the resources I believe you will find most beneficial below. They include some information you can share with the city council about the benefits of social media to help quell their concerns. In addition there is a discussion on the best way to get started with a social media page and some links that will help give you everything you need to get started including example policies and agreements. 
-What Can Social Media do for Me? http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blogpost/1958/What_can_Social_Media_do_for_Me
-9 Resources to Get You Started on Social Media http://icma.org/en/BlogPost/2174/Overcoming_the_Hurdles_Keeping_You__Your_Local_Government_from_Getting_the_Most_Out_of_Social_Media
-What is the Best Way to Create Facebook Pages for Government Departments? http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/kn/Question/21750
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Scott Andrews
text:
Hello everyone,
I was curious if any of your agencies have submitted proposals to your council recently on implementing social media. I know we may be a little behind, but we would like to start a City Facebook page and was curious what other agencies have done to quell the fears of council members. 
Thank you!
Scott Andrews
sandrews@cityofsugarhill.com
title: Local Government Social Media Proposal (Facebook)
